STD.definition: The planned departure time as published in the flight schedule
STD.context: A-CDM milestone used for initial slot allocation

ATD.definition: The actual time when aircraft leaves the gate/stand
ATD.context: A-CDM milestone tracked for delay analysis

STA.definition: The planned arrival time at destination airport
STA.context: Used for turnaround planning and slot coordination

ATA.definition: The actual time when aircraft arrives at destination gate
ATA.context: A-CDM milestone for measuring arrival performance

EXOT.definition: Predicted time when aircraft will push back from gate
EXOT.context: A-CDM calculated time used for slot optimization

EXIN.definition: Predicted time when aircraft will arrive at gate
EXIN.context: Used for turnaround and gate planning

CTOT.definition: Slot time allocated by flow management for departure

CODA.definition: European system for standardized delay reporting and analysis
CODA.context: Provides delay codes and performance metrics

A-CDM.definition: Concept improving operational efficiency through information sharing
A-CDM.context: Framework for coordinated airport operations management

Turnaround.definition: Time between arrival and departure for same aircraft

Wake_Turbulence.definition: Minimum time/distance between aircraft due to wake vortices

Runway_Capacity.definition: Maximum number of aircraft movements per hour on a runway

Slot_Coordination.definition: Process of assigning specific times for aircraft operations
Slot_Coordination.context: Manages demand vs capacity at congested airports

Peak_Hours.definition: Time windows with highest demand for airport operations
Peak_Hours.context: Critical periods requiring careful schedule management

Delay_Codes.definition: Standardized codes for categorizing flight delays
Delay_Codes.context: Used for performance analysis and accountability
